org.eng.aisp.feature.extractor.vector

Class MFCCFeatureExtractor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eng.aisp.processor.GenericCachingDataProcessor
      • org.eng.aisp.processor.AbstractCachingWindowProcessor<IDataWindow<double[]>,IFeature<double[]>>
        • org.eng.aisp.feature.extractor.vector.MFCCFeatureExtractor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, IDoubleFeatureExtractor, IFeatureExtractor<double[],double[]>, IWindowProcessor<IDataWindow<double[]>,IFeature<double[]>>

    public class MFCCFeatureExtractor
extends AbstractCachingWindowProcessor<IDataWindow<double[]>,IFeature<double[]>>
implements IDoubleFeatureExtractor
    MFCC feature extractor.
    Author:
    wangshiq Note: this was implemented before MFFBFeatureExtractor and LogMelFeatureExtractor, which are sub-sets of this extractor and so does not sub-class from them and should not change to do that in order to maintain backwards compatibility. . That said, this does now use the MFFB methods to do the computation/construction of the feature.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • maxFinalCoeffs

        protected final int maxFinalCoeffs
        As of 5/2020, this is now the final coefficients. That is, if non-zero, defines the length of the feature vector produced.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MFCCFeatureExtractor

        public MFCCFeatureExtractor()
        Constructor for MFCCFeatureExtractor with all default settings.

      • MFCCFeatureExtractor

        public MFCCFeatureExtractor(int numBands)
        Constructor for MFCCFeatureExtractor Defaults the number of final coefficients to be all the coefficients from DCT after zero-padding. The number of final coefficients is a power of 2 plus one.
        Parameters:
        numBands - Number of Mel-frequency filter bands

      • MFCCFeatureExtractor

        public MFCCFeatureExtractor(int numBands,
                            int finalCoeffs)
        Constructor for MFCCFeatureExtractor
        Parameters:
        numBands - Number of Mel-frequency filter bands
        finalCoeffs - If non-zero, then the number of coefficients in the final feature vector. If the length of the resulting array from DCT (after zero-padding) is less than maxFinalCoeffs, then the full array will be returned.

      • MFCCFeatureExtractor

        public MFCCFeatureExtractor(int numBands,
                            boolean returnAllFinalCoeffs)
        Constructor for MFCCFeatureExtractor
        Parameters:
        numBands - Number of Mel-frequency filter bands
        returnAllFinalCoeffs - If true, all the coefficients from DCT (after zero-padding) are returned; if false, return the number of coefficients equal to numBands.

      • MFCCFeatureExtractor

        public MFCCFeatureExtractor(double targetSamplingRate,
                            int numBands,
                            int minFreq,
                            int maxFreq,
                            int finalCoeffs)
        Constructor for MFCCFeatureExtractor
        Parameters:
        targetSamplingRate - if non-zero, specifies the sampling rate to re-sample the data to, as necessary, when computing the FFT.
        numBands - Number of Mel-frequency filter bands
        minFreq - Minimum frequency in Hz
        maxFreq - Maximum frequency in Hz
        finalCoeffs - If non-zero, then the number of coefficients in the final feature vector. If the length of the resulting array from DCT is less than maxFinalCoeffs, then a 0-padded array will be returned.

    • Method Detail

      • applyImpl

        protected IFeature<double[]> applyImpl(IDataWindow<double[]> window)
        Description copied from class: AbstractCachingWindowProcessor
        The actual implementation of the processing. This is only called when the result was not found in the cache. The return value will be cached for later use.
        Specified by:
        applyImpl in class AbstractCachingWindowProcessor<IDataWindow<double[]>,IFeature<double[]>>
        Returns:
        null can be returned, but it will not be cached.
